abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Second Primary
            Education Project for Pakistan was marginally satisfactory.
            The project achieved most of its objectives, its impact on
            institutional development was modest, sustainability is
            uncertain at this time, and the performance of both the Bank
            and Borrower was less than satisfactory. Several lessons can
            be learned from this project. First, the tranche approach
            used in this project was unworkable because it was
            inconsistent with the Government's own project planning
            and approval system. Also, a number of the prerequisites for
            effective tranche programming simply were not present.
            Second, the project introduced innovations and techniques
            that were outside the norms and values of the organizations
            administering the project. Finally, insufficient attention
            was paid to management and organizational issues.
